Book Review - Ruby Design Patterns

01 October 2013

I’ve recently had the pleasure of reading a book I’ve been meaning to pick up for a while: “Design Patterns in Ruby” by Russ Olsen. I read the Gang of Four’s Design Patterns in my mid-twenties and it set me upon a very different path than the one I was on, which naturally made me curious about this book. It’s funny to me that warning against ritualized and mindless use of design patterns has become almost a cliche; for me, ‘Design Patterns’ was an entry point to a much richer and more imaginative view of development. After reading the original ‘Design Patterns’, it became so much easier for me envision dynamic interactions of code.
